attributes.action: To use diplomatic pressure on the Government of Pakistan to withdraw their threats on the life of a British Citizen (Salman Rushdie) for expressing his right to freedom of speech.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Whether you liked or loathed a certain book Salman Rushdie wrote almost 20 years ago or not is not the issue here. The issue is, should the UK be trading with a country who’s Government has so openly endorsed the use of suicide bombers on a British citizen for whose only supposed crime was to put pen to paper. I am not attacking the right for Muslims to be offended and to voice their distaste; however, condoning the taking of a person’s life, especially from members in the upper echelons of the Government of Pakistan, is a step too far. If you agree with me on this matter, please sign this petition.
